item.title: Concerns medical weight-loss treatments are being advertised to vulnerable eating disorder patients
item.description: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

item.title: Young women join Country Women's Association Sydney branch in droves
item.description: More young women are joining the Country Women's Association's city branches, with a passion for jams and scones along with social connection and purpose.

item.title: Travis Head happy to see out Ashes as Australian opener before working out future role
item.description: Australia star Travis Head says he is not precious about continuing to open the batting beyond this Ashes and will bat wherever the coaches tell him to.

item.title: AI powered 2025's economy to record highs. So why are only robots smiling?
item.description: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

item.title: Deadly varroa mite threatens half of Canberra’s beehives
item.description: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ focused boxing class combatting loneliness amid warnings about social isolation
item.description: One in three adults experience social isolation in what experts say is a "dangerous" issue in society. One suburban boxing group is working to tackle the issue, focused on the LGBTQIA+ community more at risk of loneliness.

item.title: Wet season's arrival prompts moves to shore up food security in Far North Queensland
item.description: Earlier this year, a once-in-a-century flood devastated Ingham and cut the main supply route between Cairns and Townsville. Now, as intense rainfall once again triggers multiple warnings and floods roads across northern Queensland, communities are taking steps to prevent another food shortage.

item.title: How vintage black-and-white films are making a splash back in colour
item.description: Would those classic black-and-white films be the same if viewed in full colour?

item.title: Victorian master builder transforms Warrnambool house into castle for his son
item.description: They say "a man's home is his castle," but one builder from south-west Victoria has taken that literally when creating a dream home for his son.

item.title: New search for missing woman Trisha Graf near Andamooka
item.description: Police say they have "grave concerns" for a woman who has not been seen for more than two weeks in outback South Australia.

item.title: Australia coach Andrew McDonald says Usman Khawaja will play the final Ashes Test amid retirement speculation
item.description: Usman Khawaja will play in the Ashes finale at the SCG, but Australian coach Andrew McDonald remains in the dark about the 39-year-old's future beyond that.

item.title: Anthony Albanese announces terms for Richardson review of Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

item.title: England's pace bowling stocks stripped bare with Gus Atkinson out of SCG Test
item.description: England's pace bowling stocks will be stretched to their absolute limit for the final Ashes Test with Gus Atkinson ruled out with a hamstring injury.

item.title: Ahmed Al Ahmed recounts how he disarmed one of the gunmen in Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

item.title: The right way to stack your dishwasher and the verdict on rinsing beforehand
item.description: Rinsing can actually send a message to your dishwasher that your plate doesn't need as much washing.

item.title: South Australian MP Nick McBride to remain in custody for next seven days
item.description: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride will spend the next week in custody, after being arrested and charged over the weekend.

item.title: Sydney to Hobart competitors tell of 'horrendous' conditions during 2025 race ordeal
item.description: Those now safely onshore after finishing the 2025 Sydney to Hobart tell of "horrendous" conditions, resulting in injuries, broken boats and seasickness — even among experienced crew members.

item.title: Kempsey community marks 10 years since death in custody of David Dungay Jr
item.description: A decade after his death in a Sydney prison, David Dungay Jr's family hold with a memorial rally calling for change to a corrections system they say still fails to protect Indigenous people.

item.title: Man dies after sustaining critical burns in Cairns unit fire
item.description: A man dies from burns after a unit complex goes up in flames in Cairns.

item.title: Slow TV for kids: Relax and unwind with low-stimulation shows on ABC iview
item.description: Looking for screen-time options that won't leave your kids overstimulated? 'Slow TV' shows, with their soothing visuals and soundtracks, could be the answer.

item.title: Boat fire at Bonnie Doon leaves two men with serious injuries
item.description: Emergency services were on Monday called to a Lake Eildon boat ramp where two men had sustained serious injuries in a fire.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Sydney Test a golden opportunity for Cameron Green to belatedly shine in Australia
item.description: He has already proven his quality away from home, but heading into the final Test of the Ashes summer, Cameron Green remains in search of his breakthrough moment in Australia.

item.title: Legal loophole in Queensland's double jeopardy law closed
item.description: Last-minute amendments to Queensland's double jeopardy laws could allow for the retrial of botched DNA cases.

item.description: A 39-year-old man appears in court charged with the stabbing murder of a man in a remote Northern Territory community north of Alice Springs.

item.description: Hundreds of kilograms of shark heads have been left dumped outside the WA Fisheries minister's office in Margaret River, just three days before a permanent commercial demersal fishing ban comes into effect.

item.description: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

item.title: Today in History, December 30: Beatles star George Harrison stabbed at home
item.description: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, George Harrison survived an attack by a fan, but the musician's friends and family speculated it hastened his death less than two years later.

item.title: What happened when we tested a 'safe' AI mental health chatbot
item.description: Is it possible to make a "safe" AI therapy bot? We tested the limits of a new Australian-designed chatbot that's been carefully designed not to hallucinate or be your best friend.

item.title: Household battery uptake booms on back of 'game-changer' rebate
item.description: Battery uptake is booming since the federal government rebate came into effect in July. Here's what you need to know if you are thinking of joining the thousands of Australians adding a battery to their home solar systems.

item.description: After 20 years in the wilderness, the Australian Securities and Investments Commission's rehabilitation as a law enforcement agency seems almost complete.

item.title: Hiker Stella Thurbon leads herd of goats on trek through Victoria's High Country
item.description: With bells tinkling, tails flicking, and panniers packed to the brim, adventurer Stella Thurbon has spent 26 days winding through the Victorian High Country with nine goats trotting faithfully behind her.

item.title: Noongar elders say WA prescribed burn went ahead despite warnings of cultural heritage sites
item.description: Elders on WA's south coast say they tried to warn the state government about unregistered cultural sites in the path of a prescribed burn, but the burn went ahead anyway.

item.description: Swift-acting bushwalkers and emergency crews "absolutely" saved a woman bitten twice by an eastern brown snake as she hiked on the NSW south coast.

item.description: Daria Kasatkina is being backed to return from her mental health break and quickly become a fan favourite at her new home grand slam, the Australian Open.

item.description: Dying in sudden, unexpected circumstances is not something people often consider, but there are plenty of reasons to create an end-of-life plan. So why do so few people have one?

item.description: The president of the NSW Legislative Council says he will not try to overturn a decision to strike down laws that purportedly allowed witnesses to be arrested for failing to appear.

item.description: A major train line and Warnbro station are closed as firefighters battle a bushfire burning near Rockingham in Perth's south.

item.description: Ambulance Victoria says paramedics were assaulted, spat on and sexually harassed in a series of serious incidents over the festive period.

item.description: Outlet centres around Australia were bustling on Boxing Day, but just down the road, some small retailers were feeling the sting. It's a trend that could shape the future of the Boxing Day sales.

item.description: This Australian animation stars an international and local voice cast led by Nick Offerman and Nina Oyama, who can't wait for children to see the film.

item.description: About 80 passengers on the Coral Adventurer are flown home after the cruise ship ran aground on a reef off Papua New Guinea.

item.title: Kakadu traditional owner says nature has long warned us about rising sea levels
item.description: In wet season, Jonathan and his family have to drive, boat and drive again if they want to reach town. The remote NT traditional owner says nature has long been warning us about climate change, "but nobody's listening".

item.title: Crowd-funding business campaigns falter, despite demand for tipple

item.title: Denmark becomes first country in world to end letter delivery

item.title: Mechanic shortage driving Queensland businesses to look overseas for qualified workers
item.description: The automotive repair industry says it is dealing with a major labour and skills shortage, and some mechanics are looking overseas for workers.

item.description: Several gold, lithium and other mining stocks have seen their share price double, and even triple, in 2025 as Australia's share market has had a much better than expected year despite tariffs, economic uncertainty and Donald Trump's ongoing unpredictability.

item.description: Former Australian Test and limited overs batsman Damien Martyn is in hospital in Queensland in an induced coma after falling ill this week.

item.description: An hour before the clock struck 12, the harbour bridge glowed white with its pylons bearing a menorah to commemorate the 15 people killed at a Hanukkah celebration.

item.description: Outback towns remain cut off, and floodwaters are expected to linger in the north-west for weeks. Graziers have started to assess their properties and count stock losses.

item.title: Australian Winter Olympian Tess Coady fully fit for Milan-Cortina Games, after Beijing bronze medal
item.description: Fully-fit Australian snowboard medallist Tess Coady is looking forward to competing in the Winter Olympics next month in Italy after a torrid run with injury.

item.title: Father and daughter walk 13km after escape from flooded car in outback Queensland
item.description: Two people from Victoria are rescued after climbing through the window of their car as it was washed away by floodwaters in the Queensland outback.

item.title: CCTV footage captured a group of men armed with knives and machetes attacking two individuals on Lygon Street.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka defends 'Battle of the Sexes' exhibition, wants to play Nick Kyrgios again
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka does not want her "Battle of the Sexes" clash with Nick Kyrgios to be the last and insists exhibitions have a vital role to play in tennis.

item.title: Around 40 killed and 115 injured in New Year's fire at Swiss ski resort bar
item.description: Swiss President Guy Parmelin has described the blaze at Le Constellation bar as "one of the worst tragedies" the country has ever seen.

item.title: WA police searching for snorkeller missing off Ledge Point Beach, north of Perth
item.description: Authorities step up their search for a 32-year-old snorkeller missing since yesterday afternoon in the ocean off Ledge Point Beach, north of Perth, after he disappeared while diving for crayfish.

item.title: Nation's largest employer bodies throw support behind royal commission into Bondi Beach terror attack
item.description: Former Reserve Bank governors and CEOs are among more than 130 business leaders and prominent Australians calling for a Commonwealth royal commission in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

item.title: Russia says 20 killed in Ukrainian strike in occupied Kherson region
item.description: It comes as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russia is bringing the conflict "into the new year" with a barrage of drone strikes on the country's energy infrastructure.

item.title: Sydney and Melbourne property markets go backwards as national values hit speed bump
item.description: The red-hot Australian housing market is showing the first signs of easing since interest rates started rising in May 2022.

item.title: What we know about the deadly fire at a Swiss ski resort
item.description: Authorities say around 40 people are dead after a blaze ripped through a New Year's Eve event at a popular bar in Crans-Montana.

item.title: Melbourne's Victoria Street has been on a downward slide, but a brighter future may be beckoning
item.description: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

item.title: Day in History, January 2: The Yorkshire Ripper's reign of terror ended in a sudden confession
item.description: The Yorkshire Ripper's reign of terror began in the 70s and lasted for six years. In the end, he was caught by chance.

item.title: Walking with Moai: Unlocking the mysteries of Easter Island stone statues
item.description: A study using 11,600 aerial drone photos to map a mountainous quarry in 3D reveals more about how the island's famed stone sentinels were created and moved to their final resting places.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Focus apps claim to improve your productivity. Do they actually work?
item.description: To understand whether these apps are worth our while, we first need to consider why staying focused is so difficult in the first place.

item.title: Crans-Montana ski resort fire survivors say they were 'trapped' as Australian confirmed as being among injured
item.description: Swiss authorities say "a large number of young people" are among the casualties from a fire at the Crans-Montana ski resort, as work continues to identify "dozens" of bodies.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Two MPs, two legal cases and one region left bewildered
item.description: The lower house of South Australia's parliament has two representatives from the Limestone Coast. Both are now in custody.

item.title: Inside the massive protests sweeping Iran
item.description: Protests spread from the capital Tehran to other cities and across demographics, with people demanding Iran's leaders end the country's clerical rule and hold free elections.

item.title: South Australian emergency services kept busy as hot weather causes trees to drop limbs
item.description: Hot weather has caused stressed trees to drop limbs, damaging property across South Australia and injuring one person so far this summer.

item.title: Changing law to allow second home on rural land will help housing crisis, head of NSW inquiry says
item.description: The days when councils decide if a second home or a granny flat are built on NSW's largest properties could be numbered.

item.title: Why weather conditions in the Darling Downs create the perfect atmosphere for super cells
item.description: Queensland's Darling Downs has recorded more severe storm warning days than any other region this season — and meteorologists say it is no coincidence.

item.title: Hit the road in 2026 and catch some of Australia's colourful regional festivals
item.description: From pint-sized penny farthings to tuna tosses, a beer can regatta to the Running of the Sheep, there's a regional festival for everyone's interests.

item.title: Damien Martyn showing 'encouraging signs' during meningitis treatment, Adam Gilchrist says
item.description: Adam Gilchrist says there are "positive signs" from recent tests on former state and national teammate Damien Martyn, who is in hospital due to meningitis.

item.title: Flood disaster taking toll on graziers in north-west Queensland, more rain forecast for tropical coast
item.description: Rain has hit saturation point in parts of northern Queensland as communities remain isolated and cattle are lost.

item.title: Major retrospective of ceramic artist Pippin Drysdale opens in Perth
item.description: The first retrospective of the ceramic artist's work has gone on show in Perth at the state gallery, telling the story of an extraordinary career.

item.title: Artist Piiij Goodrem used honest self-portraits and therapy to heal from childhood trauma
item.description: The process of creating detailed self-portraits, inspired by tropical landscapes, helped Piiij Goodrem deal with past trauma and addiction.

item.title: Could modular and prefabricated homes be the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?
item.description: Fast to build, eco-friendly and affordable: modular and pre-fabricated homes have been touted as a possible solution to Australia's housing crisis, but manufacturers and suppliers say changes are needed to reduce costs and meet demand.

item.title: Usman Khawaja takes aim at 'racial stereotypes' during retirement announcement ahead of fifth Ashes Test
item.description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja takes aim at his critics one last time as he announces his retirement from international cricket.

item.title: Unique 'mugging' behaviour attracts intrigued whale watchers to Queensland hotspot
item.description: People normally try to avoid getting mugged, but when it comes to being mugged by humpback whales, sightseers are travelling to Queensland's whale-watching capital to witness this special event.

item.title: Authorities urge total fire ban compliance a year on from destructive WA fire
item.description: Authorities urge people to adhere to total fire ban warnings one year on from a man's "stupid, thoughtless, dumb act" to set alight a pile of leaves and leave it unattended.

item.title: Truck driver shortage looms as industry looks to refresh an aging workforce
item.description: Australia's road transport industry is facing a growing driver shortage driven by an aging workforce and limited recruitment of younger people.

item.title: As Zohran Mamdani becomes New York's mayor, what are his chances of success?
item.description: New York's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has vowed not to water down his ambitious agenda during an impassioned inauguration address outside City Hall. But is his vision achievable?

item.title: Sydney mother Melissa Austin identified as one of four NSW drowning victims
item.description: The identity of one of four people who died in a cluster of drownings on the New South Wales coast in recent days has been confirmed as a Sydney hairdresser and mother.

item.title: Usman Khawaja did it all his own way and retires a modern day Australian cricket great
item.description: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

item.title: Tennant Creek mother who died in police watch house described as well-respected and bubbly
item.description: A remote outback town is searching for answers about why a “respectful, friendly and bubbly” Aboriginal mother died in the police watch house, more than 24 hours after her Christmas Day arrest.

item.title: Lachie Neale steps down as Brisbane Lions co-captain
item.description: The club said the 32-year-old had made the decision following a "challenging personal period".

item.title: Clark MP Helen Burnet quits Greens to become a Tasmanian independent
item.description: The Clark MP says she knows the decision "will be disappointing for some," but it is necessary for her to be "effective" in parliament — a move that has "blindsided" her former colleagues.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: Ravenous ladybirds, a grumpy seal and a unique home
item.description: As we start the new year, take some time out to explore some of the other stories you might have missed this holiday period.

item.title: China's beef tariffs aren't personal as economy slows
item.description: Beijing's new measures are aimed at trying to rein in an Australian surge and manage local growth, rather than a direct target on Australia.

item.title: Research ties China's smog clean-up to hotter and drier conditions in Australia
item.description: As China caps off a historic clean-up of its smog and air pollution, the clearer air is helping temperatures rise to new records. Now, researchers are linking that change to hotter and drier conditions in Australia.

item.title: Alleged bikie granted bail after 'calculated hit' inside Queanbeyan hair salon
item.description: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.

item.title: NT to introduce Voluntary Assisted Dying legislation in 2026
item.description: The Northern Territory government says it will introduce Voluntary Assisted Dying legislation to parliament this year, nearly two decades after the Commonwealth vetoed the NT’s world-first euthanasia legislation in 1997.

item.title: Venus Williams to become oldest ever Australian Open participant after receiving wildcard
item.description: Venus Williams will play in the main draw of the Australian Open for the first time since 2021, 28 years after she first graced Melbourne Park.

item.title: Man faces court after alleged crime spree, police pursuit in Latrobe Valley
item.description: A 34-year-old man has been remanded in custody after allegedly going on a multi-day crime spree across Victoria's south-east involving carjackings, burglaries and a police pursuit.

item.title: Man who kidnapped boy from Moora home given eight-year prison sentence
item.description: A man who abducted a boy from his bed in regional WA after sniffing butane and having delusions about aliens is sentenced to eight years in prison.

item.title: Queensland housing market continues to rise as national growth slows
item.description: Brisbane's housing market remains one of the strongest in the nation, with prices up 1.6 per cent in December even as Sydney and Melbourne see some growth moderation in property valuations.

item.title: Crans-Montana ski resort fire witnesses recall how the tragic blaze unfolded
item.description: As the resort town of Crans-Montana reels from the news of a tragic fire at a New Year's Eve party, a witness recalls hearing screams and seeing people covered in blood in the aftermath of the bar blaze.

item.title: Are modular homes the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Boddington family watches heritage cottage filled with antiques go up in flames on Christmas Day
item.description: Two heritage homes and thousands of hectares of land were lost in a Christmas Day bushfire in Boddington.

item.title: Donald Trump gave a wide-ranging interview about his health. Here's what we learned
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

item.title: Three walkers rescued from Federation Peak area in Tasmania after one fell from cliff
item.description: Three bushwalkers are rescued from near Federation Peak in Tasmania's remote south-west after one of them fell 5 metres, sustaining a non-life-threatening head injury.

item.title: Todd Murphy in line for Ashes return as SCG curator allays fears over pitch's green exterior
item.description: Todd Murphy could play his first Test match on Australian soil as the curator of the SCG allays fears over the pitch.

item.title: Another e-bike death sparks renewed calls for consistency around laws
item.description: Police believe a 15-year-old boy is the first person to die in Tasmania riding an e-bike, raising questions about what laws exist to regulate e-bike safety in the state.

item.title: Maya Joint hit with illness ahead of Australia's United Cup opener against Norway
item.description: Australia's teen sensation is forced to lay low, with team captain Lleyton Hewitt hoping it is just a 24-hour thing.

item.title: Mother wallaby death sparks animal cruelty investigation in far north Queensland
item.description: Wildlife carers have lodged formal complaints with police and environment officials after stumbling across a scene involving a dead mother wallaby tied to a signpost.

item.title: Northern Territory town of Jabiru facing rolling blackouts since New Year's Eve
item.description: The remote Northern Territory town of Jabiru has faced rolling blackouts since New Year's Eve, with no clear indication of when power will be properly restored.

item.title: One man missing, another in hospital after collapse at Curragh Coal Mine in Central Queensland
item.description: One man is in hospital and another is missing following an incident at a Central Queensland coal mine.

item.title: WA police scale back search for snorkeller missing since New Year's Day
item.description: The 32-year-old man, who was part of a group of four divers snorkelling for crayfish, was reported missing off Ledge Point Beach.

item.title: Emergency services downgrade bushfire warning for Mundaring residents
item.description: Authorities say the bushfire is moving in a north-easterly direction but is currently stationary.

item.title: Donald Trump says US will 'come to their rescue' if Iran kills protesters
item.description: President Donald Trump says the United States is "locked and loaded" to respond if Iran kills protesters, prompting Tehran to warn that intervention would destabilise the region.
